author: sky.cactus
content: It only provides CR if block builders don't censor all private transactions.  Historically, block builders have done exactly that (censored all Tornado source/destination transactions), so we should assume they will do so again if they have the ability to.

author: greystroke
content: Even at its height of censorship,  TC txs still had a ~15% chance of inclusion every slot. The price of using a stealth address tx type at worst would similarly be modestly delayed inclusion. FOCiL, if implemented, will also help decrease the censorship of these stealth tx types. Even moreso if encrypted mempools such as the shutterized beacon chain are eventually implemented like on gnosis chain.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm just saying that base layer private transactions won't provide a CR benefit over TC.  We can expect similar/same censorship over both.

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree that FOCIL should be very high priority to combat builder censorship as they continue to centralize.
